title: Hide the 6th column from the SheetViewer table

requirements.summary: Hide the 6th column (index 5) from the SheetViewer table so it is never rendered in the UI
acceptanceCriteria: The 6th column (index 5) header cell is not rendered in the table header row.
No data cell for the 6th column (index 5) is rendered in any table data row.
All other columns (indices 0â€“4 and 6+) continue to display correctly.
The table layout and styling remain intact after removing the 6th column.
The column/row count summary in the page header accurately reflects the displayed columns (i.e., total columns minus 1 hidden).

file_operations.description: Modify the table rendering logic to skip the 6th column (index 5). Filter out the 6th element from the headers array before mapping to <th> elements. In the data row mapping, filter out the 6th element from each row array before mapping to <td> elements. Update the column count display logic to subtract 1 from the total column count to reflect that one column is hidden. Ensure all other columns render normally and the table layout remains intact.
